author: Anonymous Poet
title: Earbuds for noise not allowed?
question:
Hi,

I always wear earbuds to protect myself from noises in exams. But I saw one bullet in the midterm 2 instructions saying that "Wear earbuds/headphones of any kind." are not allowed... Does that mean I cannot wear my foam earplugs to prevent those typing noises around? It will be really uncomfortable...

Thanks~
instructor_answer: Non-electronic earplugs are permitted but earbuds/headphones are not. If noise is a significant distractor for you, I would recommend registering with the Centre for Accessibility as one of the exam accommodations they can provide is a distraction reduced environment.
